sentences.en: A volcano erupted and propelled rocks high into the sky.
sentences.cn: 火山爆发,把无数的石块抛向天空.

sentences.en: An active volcano may erupt at any time.
Etna is Europe's most active volcano.
sentences.cn: 埃特纳山是欧洲最活跃的火山。

sentences.en: He is painting a huge volcano.
sentences.cn: 他正在画一座巨大的火山。

sentences.en: He says it's like a volcano ready to erupt.
sentences.cn: 他说这就像一座即将喷发的火山。

sentences.en: Its tallest volcano, long extinct, is Olympus Mons.
sentences.cn: 它最高的火山是早已熄灭的奥林波斯山。

sentences.en: Lava is extruded from the volcano.
Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.cn: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

sentences.en: Rainfall had dislodged debris from the slopes of the volcano.
sentences.cn: 雨水冲走了火山坡面上的岩屑。

sentences.en: The expulsion of dust from the volcano was visible from miles away.
sentences.cn: 火山喷出的灰尘几英里之外就能看得见.

sentences.en: The lava flowed down the sides of the volcano.
sentences.cn: 熔岩沿火山坡面涌流而下.

sentences.en: The volcano could erupt at any time.
sentences.cn: 这座火山随时可能爆发。

sentences.en: The volcano erupted last year killing about 600 people.
sentences.cn: 去年那座火山喷发致使约600人遇难。

sentences.en: The volcano spewed out more scorching volcanic ashes, gases and rocks.
sentences.cn: 火山喷出更多灼热的火山灰、气体和岩块。

sentences.en: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.cn: 火山又向空中喷出了岩浆和火山灰。

sentences.en: The volcano unexpectedly blew up early in the morning.
